etymologies: late Middle English (originally used also of other skin conditions): via Latin from Greek herpēs ‘shingles’, literally ‘creeping’, from herpein ‘to creep’

definitions: any of a group of viral diseases caused by herpes viruses, affecting the skin (often with blisters) or the nervous system.
shortDefinitions: any of group of virus diseases caused by herpesviruses, affecting skin often with blisters
